Kamal Ahmed wrote:
> Dear Todd,
> 
> 
> 
> I am reading the following books, but maybe not as fast as you would expect
> me to.
> 
> 
> 
> 1.      JUnit Recipes, By J.B Raisenberger
> 2.      Pragmatic Unit Testing in Java with JUnit, by Andrew Hunt and David
> Thomas
> 3.      JUnit in Action, by Vincent Massol
> 4.      Extreme Programming with Ant, by Niemeyer Poteet.

I don't know about #4, but I do recommend the other 3. I strongly 
recommend Feathers' book, as well. I would put it #2.

> I would welcome any suggestions, by you as well. My Java experience is only
> school, and 3 months at my previous job. So if my questions are at a level
> lower then you would expect to see,

Thanks for this background information. It helps me better understand 
what to assume you know and don't know. We can help you out.

> Then please let me know, I'll look elsewhere. And I do appreciate your
> criticism, I will look more into the books first before asking any question.

Don't worry: ask your questions, even if all we do is forward to back to 
the books. :) In particular, ask questions about how to apply those 
techniques to your codebase.

Good luck.
-- 
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info
